name: singing in the rain fashion pin
description:
Sweet pin made from silk roving, stitched to dupioni silk on top a piece of wool felt for strength and a round pin back for security.

Down and dirty measurments:  2 and 1/2 inches wide by 2 inches tall, less then 1/8 inch thick...mmm perfection!

name: Dutch Swirl wrist cuff
description:
In laid dutch swirls expose a wonderful navy to grey Kona cotton fabric. So sweetly victorian with a steam punk twist. 

Details: Dupioni silk ruffle, 100% wool grey felt, repurposed buttons from an antique shop, Kona cotton lining. Measures 4 inches long.

name: Stormy Sky fiber art
description:
I have been in love with the impressionist almost my entire life therefore it is no secret where most of my inspiration comes.

My first love was Degas the soft lines, colors and subjects were fascinating to me. SOO when I lived in New Jersey I took many trips to NYC. On one of those wonderful NYC trips my dad and I were at the Guggenheim where our eyes misted at the sight of a finger print cast into a Degas bronze sculptor. We looked at it point and looked up to each other..noses almost touching. The guard all the while asking us to step back. WE could not hear that guard but my husband ( a dog cones-our) could. My husband had to reach out and physically break that magical moment my dad and I had shared. 

Stormy night is based off of a Montana stormy sky. The state where my father currently resides. It is made from batik fibers hand shredded then quilted together using variegated cotton "Superior" long stapled thread.

Stormy measures 36 inches in height and around 77 inches in length.

name: Storm at Sea wearable fiber art scarf
description:
Light netting in the middle leads to swirls of butterfly blue cotton yarns twined with silver butterfly cotton yarn and metallic fashion yarn. The netting is a variegated yummy super fine merino wool and kid mohair all quilted together with variegated cotton blue thread.

It measures around 77 inches long and 4 to 5 inches wide.

name: Radish in the Garden
description:
Time to start your cold crop seeds!?! 

This is a sweet pin made from www.diamondpirate.etsy.com silk/wool roving! I used Dupioni silk layered the roving and machine quilted the radish in a field of bubbles. So sweet and spicy!

It is around 2 and half inches wide and around 3 inches long. 

Pin it to a purse, your lapel, or use it as a closer to a scarf!
